result.execSummary:
The defendant John S Sudano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John S Sudano

defendant.name: Sudano, John S
defendant.address: 2205 N University Dr Apt 8, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John S Sudano in court.  Attorney John Scott Schiro in court for John S Sudano. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense states that case is resolved. 

Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8) of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.

State makes disposition arguments. Defense makes disposition arguments. 

Court orders the following:
$267.50 to be paid within 60 days or civil judgment entered subject to collections, as penalty for non payment of fine. 
Court orders forfeiture of firearm used in incident.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

File not called on the record.
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Abigail Kincheloe, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John S Sudano in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  

Defense is still waiting on audio discovery.
  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to go armed with any dangerous weapons/firearms.  The firearms that are in possession of the defendant shall remain in a locked safe.  The State has no objection to these conditions.

08:38 AM Defendant John S Sudano in court with Peter Heflin for attorney John Scott Schiro.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
